intro: Casparia oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxaca thistle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features spiny leaves and produces purple to pink flowers that bloom in the spring. Casparia oaxacana is adapted to rocky and dry environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. Its botanical structure supports its role as a food source for local wildlife and contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
